title: Does USPS Deliver on Sundays & Holidays? What to Know

steps.title: Yes—but only in high-volume locations and large metros.
steps.content: Yes—but only in high-volume locations and large metros. Contrary to popular belief, USPS delivers packages on the weekend, including Sunday—for certain packages at least. If you live in a large metropolitan city or high-volume location, Priority Mail Express and select Amazon packages will reach your doorstep. [1] X Research source Large metro areas include, but are not limited to, New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas, Washington DC, and more. [2] X Research source During major US holidays, like Christmas, USPS may deliver all packages on Sundays due to an increase in volume. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Priority Mail Express or Overnight
steps.content: Priority Mail Express or Overnight Priority Mail Express, also called USPS Overnight, is the fastest delivery service the United States Post Office has to offer. It guarantees overnight delivery to most locations within the United States, with International services taking between 3 to 5 business days. [4] X Research source However, for Sunday delivery, you’ll need to pay an additional $12.50 fee on top of the regular postage. Regular retail ground mail and other classes of mail are delivered by 5 pm Monday through Saturday. [5] X Research source Priority Mail Express starts from $30.45 for packages and flat-rate envelopes. [6] X Research source Standard postage fees are calculated by the item’s location, size, and weight.

steps.title: Amazon packages
steps.content: Amazon packages If you’ve ever wondered if Amazon delivers on Sundays , you’re in luck. If you’re in an eligible area, you can expect your Amazon goods to arrive between 9 am and 8 pm. In 2013, USPS partnered with Amazon to deliver select packages on Sundays. [7] X Research source To check your Sunday delivery, check your order history for the estimated delivery date. Amazon packages require no additional fees from USPS for Sunday delivery.

steps.title: Use the 22-digit tracking number to locate your package.
steps.content: Use the 22-digit tracking number to locate your package. If your package has a tracking number, visit https://www.usps.com/ . A search bar will be featured on the home page, where you can manually insert the 22-digit tracking number. You will be redirected to another page that provides the latest update on the item. It will also include the time and date the package was delivered. [8] X Research source You can find your tracking number on a USPS receipt or through the company you ordered. Check your account’s Order History or your email.

steps.title: USPS delivers all package types on Saturdays.
steps.content: USPS delivers all package types on Saturdays. If you’re waiting for a letter or a big delivery on a Saturday, don’t worry! Your package should arrive no later than 5 pm on a Saturday. If you want to pick up or mail a package on a Saturday, double-check your local post office’s operating hours. Saturday service may be limited, typically from 9 am to 1 pm or 3 pm. Services may be closed in low-volume areas. [9] X Research source Use the location finder on the USPS website to get the hours of operation for your nearest post office.

steps.title: USPS is open Monday through Friday, with select services on Saturday.
steps.content: USPS is open Monday through Friday, with select services on Saturday. Generally, post offices are open weekdays from 9 am to 5 pm. However, services may vary depending on the location and demand. [10] X Research source If you have a PO Box, most USPS locations offer 24/7 service, so you can pick up your mail anytime. Hours may vary depending on your location. Visit the USPS website or call your local office for more information. [11] X Research source

steps.title: USPS is closed on Sundays and federal US holidays.
steps.content: USPS is closed on Sundays and federal US holidays. Want to send out a package on a Sunday? Unfortunately, you’ll have to wait until Monday—or head to your nearest USPS participating Staples location to mail your package. While it won’t deliver or ship on Sunday, you can have your package scanned and ready to ship the following morning. [12] X Research source USPS is also closed on the following US federal holidays: [13] X Research source January 1st: New Year’s Day January 15th: Martin Luther King, Jr.’s Birthday February 19th: Presidents’ Day May 27th: Memorial Day June 19th: Juneteenth National Independence Day July 4th: Independence Day September 3rd: Labor Day October 14th: Columbus day November 11th: Veterans Day November 28th: Thanksgiving Day December 25th: Christmas Day
